  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT FROM A SMALL CAP. FLOW OF PACKAGE WAS STOPPED AND OTHER EMPLOYEES WERE KEPT AWAY. RESPONDER WAS CALLED WHO CLEANED UP THE LIQUID PER THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET AND BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2025010008
item.description:
Report I-2025010008

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: American Airlines received a fibreboard box that contained AA aircraft parts in Charlotte (CL T) from Shipper of a MRO, VT Mobile Aerospace (BFM) which contained a styrofoam box and inside was a Oxygen Generator Panel, which had a live chemical oxygen generator and 4 masks inside the panel. The styrofoam box was insidea non spec fibreboard box, where several other aircraft parts that were non hazardous. No marks, labels, packaging or communication for hazardous materials was found.
